msContents.summary: Receipt in epistolary form: Athenodoros writes to Eukles and Agathokles that he received from the farmer Herakleides advance payment for vine props

msItemStruct.note: On the back, across the fibers, there is also the address; in addition, a second hand wrote some accountant's figures and an abbreviation in a fine, clear hand

18 lines written on the front along the fibers with rough letters all separated, interlinear corrections, cancellations, and faulty alignment; the text continues on the back with 6 lines across the fibers and upside down

provenance.p: Purchased by Columbia University from M. Nahman and New York dealer J. Brummer, through H.I. Bell, November 1925; no. 10 (original no. 8) in Bell's inventory

taxonomy.desc: APIS keywords are controlled locally at the institution level. They are not necessarily consistent.

keywords.term: Other names, -- see Pap.Lugd.Bat. XXI, sec. IX

div.ab: Athenodoros to Eukles and Agathokles greeting. I have received from Herakleides, farmer, pay for reed propping to the number of 65,000 reeds at 4 obols per ten thousand, total 4 drachmas 2 obols, on the understanding that I will furnish them at the farms being listed from your office for the vineyard operations of the 40th year or pay back 4 drachmas per ten thousand and the penalty. This is the remainder of the money paid me for cutting vine props in the 38th year. [Verso:]. And (in case of nonfulfillment) I will pay back in addition at the same time also the 4 drachmas 2 obols paid me on the 23d of Phaophi for the 65,000 reeds. Good-by. Year 39, Phaophi 23. [Notations of an accountant.] [Address.] To Eukles and Agathokles.

listBibl.bibl: P.Col. IV 76 P.Col.Zen. II 76 Corrections to line 19 and 21 by Reekmans, BL IV p. 22
